DataElement.preferredName: Exudate Adjacent Tissue Assessment Yes or No Response
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Material, such as purulent and nonpurulent fluid, cells, or cellular debris, which has escaped from blood vessels and has been deposited in tissues or on tissue surfaces, usually as a result of inflammation.  An exudate, in contrast to a transudate, is characterized by a relatively high protein content. Next to or adjoining. An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function. The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of. A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function. The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
